arts.ttl: FA Cup roundup: Hull sunk by League Two Doncaster, Phillips inspires Ipswich
arts.sum: Doncaster go through on penalties after 1-1 draw Kalvin Phillips helps Ipswich beat Bristol Rovers 3-0 Grant McCann expressed deep pride after League Two side Doncaster defeated Hull 5-4 on penalties in the third round of the FA Cup. With the score 1-1 following extra time, Harry Clifton converted the winning spot-kick after Mason Burstow and Alfie Jones missed for the Championship team. Earlier, Luke Molyneux had given Doncaster the lead shortly after half-time but Hull equalised in the 80th minute when Gustavo Puerta followed up Burstowâ€™s low shot that hit the base of the left post. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Hull City boss issues transfer update as he opens up on FA Cup frustrations
arts.sum: Speaking about the game itself, which saw the Tigers fall behind to Luke Molyneux's goal six minutes into the second half after Ryan Giles gifted him the ball before Gustavo Puerta turned in with nine minutes left and send the tie into extra-time and penalties. "I think that the games in the FA Cup are always difficult, but a lot of things happened today.

arts.ttl: Doncaster shock Hull with penalty shootout victory to reach FA Cup round four
arts.sum: Harry Clifton scored the winning spot-kick after Mason Burstow and Alfie Jones missed.

arts.ttl: Below-par Hull City's FA Cup misery continues after dismal Doncaster defeat
arts.sum: Rovers stormed into the lead early in the second half when Molyneux robbed the pocket of Ryan Giles to slot beyond debutant Carl Rushworth and break the deadlock, and in truth, the turgid hosts rarely looked like getting back into it, so tepid were they, until Mason Burstow hit the post and Puerta slammed in the rebound with 10 minutes to go. Pedro was fouled on the edge of the Rovers box on the cusp of half-time, with John McGrath booked, and from that, the Italian international forced a good low save from the goalkeeper, as City looked to try and find a breakthrough, and that should have come in added time at the end of a first which started brightly before resembling a pre-season game with a host of stoppages when Slater and Kamara combined nicely to see the winger strike wide of the far post from the right side of the box.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Doncaster Rovers as Tigers embarrassed by League Two side
arts.sum: City rallied and scored a well-made equalise when Mason Burstow's shot hit the post but fell kindly to Gustavo Puerta to turn in the equaliser from close range to take the game into extra-time, and Harry Clifton's kick won it after Mason Burstow and Alfie Jones failed to score. The League Two side took their chance seven minutes into the second half when Ryan Giles did not cover himself in glory, allowing Luke Molyneux to take the ball off him and slot into the bottom corner.

arts.ttl: FA Cup fourth round draw LIVE: Liverpool, Chelsea, Man City learn opponents after Arsenal vs Man Utd clash
arts.sum: The draw for the fourth round takes place, with fixtures to be played on the weekend of 8 February

arts.ttl: Tamworth vs Tottenham - FA Cup: Live score, team news and updates as game is delayed by five minutes as goal net has to be fixed by home player shortly before kick-off with National League side looking to cause cupset
arts.sum: Follow Mail Sport live blog for the latest live score, team news and updates as National League side Tamworth host Tottenham at the Lamb Ground in the third round of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Hull City vs Doncaster Rovers LIVE FA Cup third round updates and reaction from MKM Stadium
arts.sum: Sheffield United 0-1 Cardiff City Exeter City 3-1 Oxford United

arts.ttl: Hull City closing in on Joe Gelhardt transfer as Leeds United man set to join
arts.sum: Hull Live understands Leeds has now sanctioned Gelhardt's exit, and a deal to bring the 22-year-old to the MKM Stadium could be confirmed in the next 48 hours after he was left out of the Whites squad, which beat Harrogate 1-0 in the FA Cup on Saturday. Hull City are edging closer to the signing of striker Joe Gelhardt after agreeing a deal with Championship rivals Leeds United to bring him in on loan until the end of the season.

arts.ttl: Predicted Hull City line up for Doncaster Rovers with summer signing in line for his Tigers bow
arts.sum: City's predicted starting XI: Rushworth, Jacob, Smith, Jones, Drameh, Burns, Simons, Vaughan, Kamara, Burstow, Pedro. Rushworth, who joined City on the final day of the summer window from Brighton and Hove Albion, has not yet made an appearance after suffering a major injury setback in October which has kept him sidelined since, but the FA Cup presents him with an opportunity after coming through a clear week in training.
